net.jxta.content
Interface ContentProvider

All Known Subinterfaces:
ContentProviderSPI, ContentService
All Known Implementing Classes:
ContentServiceImpl, DefaultContentProvider, SRDISocketContentProvider
public interface ContentProvider

ContentProvider implementations define a single methodology and/or protocol to obtain content from a (potentially) remote data source. This interface describes the publicly accessible portion of the larger ContentProviderSPI interface and is meant for direct use by the end user, possibly (and more desirably) through the ContentService layer.

If you are a user interested in the general functionality provided by this package, you will more likely be interested in using the higher- level ContentService interface rather than directly using a single ContentProvider.

Why the separation between the ContentProvider and ContentProviderSPI interfaces? This was done to allow a ContentService implementation to maintain a collection of ContentProviderSPI objects for it's own use and allow a restricting typecast of this list to be returned in the ContentService.getContentProviders() interface method, without needlessly exposing lifecycle methods to end users.

An explicit effort was made to ensure that ContentProvider instances would always be accessible to the end-user. This maintains the ability to use operations such as instanceof to identify a specific provider programatically, allowing a typecast or bean introspection to provide in-depth provider-specific tuning controls, etc..

You'll note some methods are allowed to be unsupported. This was done for the following reason(s):

  • Some providers may be based on an underlying data store such as an existing read-only filesystem. In such a scenario, explicitly sharing or unsharing Content instances may not always make sense.

The findContentShares method was created in such a way as to allow asynchronous results to be returned to the requestor. This was done for three primary reasons:

  1. If the ContentProvider fronted a huge filesystem, returning the results in a single chunk (array, List, etc.) could easily become limited by available memory.
  2. Returning partial sets more often (as opposed to a single set upon completion) allows applications to remain responsive for large result sets.
  3. It allows for large operations to be asynchronously cancelled.

See Also:
ContentProviderSPI, ContentService

Method Detail

addContentProviderListener

void addContentProviderListener(ContentProviderListener listener)
Adds a provider listener.

Parameters:
listener - interested party.

removeContentProviderListener

void removeContentProviderListener(ContentProviderListener listener)
Removes a provider listener.

Parameters:
listener - uninterested party.

retrieveContent

ContentTransfer retrieveContent(ContentID contentID)
                                throws UnsupportedOperationException
Retrieve the advertised Content if the provider supports automatic (or implicit) discovery of remote shares.

Parameters:
contentID - ContentID Unique ID of the Content to attempt to retrieve.
Returns:
ContentTransfer object representing a potential future transfer of the Content or null if this provider knows immediately and up-front that it cannot handle the advertisement provided.
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException

retrieveContent

ContentTransfer retrieveContent(ContentShareAdvertisement adv)
Retrieve the advertised Content if the share advertisement can be understood or (optionally) if the ContentAdvertisement embedded in the share advertisement can be used to automatically discover remote shares.

Provider implementations should use the ContentAdvertisement contained within the share advertisement if it can be understood. If it cannot be understood, or if the provider implementations detects a failure to retrieve the Content, the provider may attempt to locate alternative data sources automatically.

Parameters:
adv - ContentAdvertisement of the Content to attempt to retrieve.
Returns:
ContentTransfer object representing a potential future transfer of the Content or null if this provider knows immediately and up-front that it cannot handle the advertisement provided.

shareContent

List<ContentShare> shareContent(Content content)
                                throws UnsupportedOperationException
Serve the provided Content to remote requestors. The Content will be served to all requestors until either the JXTA platform exits or until this Content is explicitly unshared.

Parameters:
content - Content to share publicly.
Returns:
list of all share tracking objects, or null if this Content can not be shared by the provider for some reason
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if the provider does not support explicit share addition.

unshareContent

boolean unshareContent(ContentID contentID)
                       throws UnsupportedOperationException
If the specified ContentID has been previously shared this method disposes of any references to the Content and no longer serves any additional requests for the Content in question.

Parameters:
contentID - ID of the Content to no longer share.
Returns:
true if a previously shared object was unshared, false otherwise.
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if the provider does not support explicit share removal.

findContentShares

void findContentShares(int maxNum,
                       ContentProviderListener listener)
                       throws UnsupportedOperationException
Collects a list of all ContentShares being served by this ContentProvicer instance, notifying the provided ContentListener as they are discovered by calling the listener's contentSharesFound method. Only ContentShare objects being shared by this service instance are returned - no remote discovery is performed.

Implementations may choose whether to respond immediately by notifying the listener prior to the call to findContentShares returns, or optionally by scheduling the lookup operation for deferred background processing. The caller should not make any assumptions as to which of the two approaches may be used.

Parameters:
maxNum - maximum number of shares to return, or < 0 for unlimited
listener - listener to notify when shares are found
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if the underlying provider mechanism does not support share enumeration.
